subtitle: Thinking Allowed, conversations on the leading
edge of knowledge and discovery with psychologist

Hello and welcome.
I'm Jeffrey Mishlove.
Today we're going to explore part two of our series with Dr. Charles Tremont on his
journey from medicine to metaphysics.
Dr. Tremont is a former director of surgery at a hospital in Ohio where he used to live
before he moved to Las Vegas where I've known him now for 16 years.
He is currently a hypnotherapist.
He is the author of several books including From Birth to Rebirth and What's Missing
in Medicine.
I would encourage our viewers if they haven't
watched part one of this two-part series that
they take a look at part one because we covered a lot of ground.
I know, I know.
Jumped around.
We've really been talking about a journey that you took from being a flight surgeon
working with the Air Force to becoming in effect an exorcist.
Well it's very interesting but I jumped around
and when I got to this hypnosis and past life

where he had an earthbound spirit attached
to him and I had regressed the spirit instead of him.
But after doing a lot of research I learned an

the dark forces in fair detail earlier.
The next group is a human group called Earthbound

she's still got to think about women.

Patient goes under anesthesia and wakes up speaking of foreign accents.

A fragment of a soul.

Yes, two.

It's three phrases, and the first two phrases
are repeated three times, the last phrase
once.
First phrase is, the light of God never fails.
Second phrase, three times.
Next phrase is, I live this day in god light.
Last phrase, the harmony of my true being is my ultimate protection.
And I know it works because I've had patients
loaded with all kinds of stuff come back two,
three years later.
And if they were consistent doing their protections, still no foreign energy.
Others that didn't do it very well, they didn't do it a lot, loaded again.
So I have a pretty good idea it works.
Has there ever been any independent verification

Yes.
